question.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect for the reason of opting scientific names over vernacular names?

options.text: Vernacular names cannot be used in communications.
Some vernacular names have incorrect meaning.
Some vernacular names are particularly used for specific organisms only.
All organisms do not occur in an area.

solution.text: Vernacular or common names are the names given to the organisms in a particular language and region of the world. Sometimes a single organism is known by several names in the same language, e.g. Water lily has 81 Dutch names. A single name is often used for two or more species. e.g., Touch-me-not is the name for both Impatiens balsamifera (Balsam) and Mimosa pudica.
